intro: Dianthus balbisii subsp. balbisii, commonly known as the Balbis's campion, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of about 30 to 60 centimeters. The plant features simple, alternate leaves that are usually hairy and have a distinctive grayish-green color. Its flowers are pink to red in color, with five petals and a prominent central yellow stamen. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or dry habitats.
